name: 1960s television
description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

key_work.title: 1960s Australian TV miniature
key_work.credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
key_work.brief_description: This gorgeous model miniature celebrates the screen stories Australians loved during the 1960s.

constellations_primary.name: 1960s television
constellations_primary.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

constellations_primary.name: 1960s television
constellations_primary.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

end.title: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo
end.brief_description: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo is one of Australia’s most beloved TV series, which followed the adventures of a young boy and his kangaroo solving problems and kids from wells.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

links.description: By the time the 60s rolled around, TV had embedded itself into the hearts and homes of Australians, but most of the shows were syndicated from overseas with government bodies pushing for more local shows like Skippy The Bush Kangaroo.

start.title: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo
start.brief_description: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo is one of Australia’s most beloved TV series, which followed the adventures of a young boy and his kangaroo solving problems and kids from wells.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

end.title: Four Corners
end.brief_description: Four Corners is Australia’s longest-running investigative journalism/current affairs television program. It addresses a single issue in depth each week, showing either a locally produced program or a relevant documentary from overseas.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

links.description: Skippy was like many popular shows at the time about animals helping their owners. It had a massive international audience of 300m viewers per week but eventually ended, unlike Four Corners, which also started in the 60s and still runs.

start.title: Four Corners
start.brief_description: Four Corners is Australia’s longest-running investigative journalism/current affairs television program. It addresses a single issue in depth each week, showing either a locally produced program or a relevant documentary from overseas.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

end.title: Homicide
end.brief_description: Homicide was an Australian TV cop show that dealt with the homicide squad of the Victorian Police force and the various crimes and cases the detectives are called upon to investigate. Many episodes were based on real-life crime cases.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

links.description: Four Corners has been exposing scandals, triggering inquiries, firing debate and confronting taboos since it debuted. Homicide debuted a few years later and was one of Australia’s first crime dramas targeted at a mature audience.

start.title: Dead Calm
start.creator_credit: Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Terry Hayes and Warner Bros. Pictures
start.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1989
start.brief_description: An Australian couple take a sailing trip in the Pacific to forget about a terrible accident. While on the open sea, in dead calm weather conditions, they come across a ship with one survivor who is not at all what he seems.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

end.title: Destroyer
end.creator_credit: Audrey Fisher, Fred Berger, Matt Manfredi and Phil Hay
end.brief_description: Erin Bell is an LAPD detective who was placed undercover with a Californian gang with tragic results. When the leader re-emerges years later, she must work her way back into her own history to finally reckon with the demons that destroyed her past.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

links.description: Phillip Noyce had been working in industry since the 60s when he had his breakthrough with Dead Calm, which helped launch the careers of Billy Zane and Nicole Kidman, who also starred in police drama Destroyer from Karyn Kusama.

start.title: Homicide
start.brief_description: Homicide was an Australian TV cop show that dealt with the homicide squad of the Victorian Police force and the various crimes and cases the detectives are called upon to investigate. Many episodes were based on real-life crime cases.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

end.title: The Phantom
end.creator_credit: Alan Ladd Jr. and Robert Evans
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1996
end.brief_description: The 21st successor to the role of Bengalla’s resident superhero must travel to New York to prevent a rich madman from obtaining three magic skulls that would give him the secret to ultimate power.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

links.description: Homicide became a TV phenomenon, airing 509 episodes. It also became a training ground for a whole wave of Australian filmmakers who got their start directing on the program, such as George Miller, Colin Eggleston and Simon Wincer who was behind The Phantom.

start.title: The Phantom
start.creator_credit: Alan Ladd Jr. and Robert Evans
start.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1996
start.brief_description: The 21st successor to the role of Bengalla’s resident superhero must travel to New York to prevent a rich madman from obtaining three magic skulls that would give him the secret to ultimate power.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

end.title: Dead Calm
end.creator_credit: Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Terry Hayes and Warner Bros. Pictures
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1989
end.brief_description: An Australian couple take a sailing trip in the Pacific to forget about a terrible accident. While on the open sea, in dead calm weather conditions, they come across a ship with one survivor who is not at all what he seems.

constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

links.description: The Phantom was a comic book blockbuster and the first film shot at Village Roadshow Studios on the Gold Coast. Star Billy Zane fell in love with the character after being introduced to The Phantom comic strip while on the set of Dead Calm.
